title: RF network
extract: RF and Waves Wireless networking is an RF (radio frequency) technology. Air is the vehicle through which the data is carried, just as Ethernet uses copper cables. WLAN frequency ranges are in the 2.4GHz and 5GHZ bands. The most common legacy wireless standards, 802.11b and 802.11g, use the 2.4GHz range.Oct 15, 2012
